title: Police officers rescue ducklings who fell down the drain and reunited them to their mother
text:
Hero police officers have rescued four little ducklings who fell down a drain and were separated from their mother.

An onlooker witnessed the ducks fall into a storm water drain at Gadigal Avenue in Waterloo, in Sydney, on Thursday morning.

The ducklings were rescued at 9.30am by two officers and returned to their mother, police said.

This little duckling was among the four who fell down a storm water drain and has had to be rescued

Two hero police officers rescued four ducklings and successfully returned the group to their mother

The heartwarming rescue was uploaded to NSW Police's Facebook page.

'What a quacking good story,' one wrote.

'Kwacks me up,' another wrote.

One added: 'Love that this took a police rescue operation to save the ducklings.'
description: An onlooker witnessed the ducks fall into a storm water drain at Gadigal Avenue in Waterloo, an inner-city suburb in Sydney, on Thursday morning.
authors: Paula Ahillon For Daily Mail Australia
